Between them, Student_D is ranked higher than Student_E, so accepting D is better than accepting E if I must choose now. However, my top two (Student_C and Student_B) have not contacted me yet; Student_C ranks School_C 4th and Student_B ranks School_C 5th, so they are unlikely to apply early, but could still come later if rejected elsewhere. With only one seat, accepting Student_D now locks in a 3rd-choice outcome for me but guarantees a solid match with a student who has School_C as first choice. Rejecting D to wait is risky because I might end up with Student_E (ranked lower) or possibly no one if others never apply. Given D’s strong commitment and higher priority than E, I should accept Student_D now to secure a relatively high-ranked match within my list.
